WorkItem.ClosedComment:
I'm not able to reproduce this using the latest bits from the development branch. 


Does it happen in projects of all sizes or only large projects. 

Thanks
WorkItem.Description:
I am using 0.9 preview. However, whenever I write something in a try catch block, intellisense  gone completely in the TS file, while others TS file are still having intellisense, as long as I don't write anything inside the try catch block. 

Creating a new try catch block with empty content will also trigger the same problem.

Reloading the file or the solution won't fix the problem.

The only way to restore intellisense is to restart VS IDE.

Now I have to be very careful and write a try catch block in Programmer's Notepad and then copy/paste back to VS IDE. Odd and troublesome.

:(
WorkItem.Summary: intellisense gone whenever writing something in a try catch block.

Comments.Message: More exactly, reloading solution restores intellisense for some files, but not all.
And, any editing near but outside a try catch block may also trigger the problem.
If I remove the map file, reloading the ts file may restore intellisense. This seems to work for all, though some TS files could have intellisense even if the map file is accompanied.

Even a fresh app.ts created by the IDE suffers the same problem as soon as I add a try catch block.

I had 0.8.3.1, and uninstalled it, then installed 0.9. I guess the clean up process of the uninstallation is not clean enough

It might be just me, and I had a silly work around now. Hopefully next release will be better.
